website_summaries.verdict: The most mobile-friendly printer you can buy today.
pros: Built-in auto duplex printing is amazing at simplifying complicated projects
It takes home printing to a new level of technology
cons: The lack of error messages on misprints frustrates some consumers

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it!
customer_reviews.text: I thought the Epson ET-2760 would be a nice home use printer to compliment the ET-3750 I use at my office. Wrong. The minuscule 1 inch screen makes programming and set up tedious and annoying at best. The wireless setup is also confusing and difficult. I sent this model back the next day and opted for the more expensive ET-3700, which is a dream in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Wood

customer_reviews.title: The screen on the ET-2760 is way too small.
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering the ET-2760 keep in mind that the 1.4" screen is a joke. There just aren't enough pixels to display certain symbols. Imagine trying to differentiate these images in the corner of a 1.44" screen... ⟲⊗⊚. Also the model I received (7/2019) did not have an ethernet port, regardless what the description says. Wifi connection was a disaster and I could not get the scan to cloud function to work even with the help of customer support. Print quality was great, and loading the paper was simple. The models above the et-2760 seem to address these issues, so if are considering this printer I would definitely skip this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Billingslea

customer_reviews.title: What exactly demands the high price?
customer_reviews.text: I just set this printer up and it loses WIFI connection after every print job. It has a 'one inch' screen that is an absolute joke. The plastic used to make this printer is the flimsiest garbage around. So why the higher price compare to other ink jets? The fact that they're not making as much money in ink sales means they have to gouge you up front. If it would have worked I might have kept it, but it's just another garbage printer by another garbage printer manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: KitchenBuilder

customer_reviews.title: What in the friggin world is wrong with this thing?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to print colored pictures and the print quality for colored pictures is AWFUL. What in the world?! How is the quality THIS terrible after paying 350 dollars for this product?!
customer_reviews.author: Tactical Ribeye

customer_reviews.title: Print Quality mediocre, No A5 paper support, auto-duplex for only certain sizes
customer_reviews.text: Print Quality mediocre. Don't even bother to do photo printing. No A5 paper support. Very odd since A2, A3, A4, and A6 are all there. Auto-duplex for only certain sizes of paper ADF pretty hit-or-miss with jams or not feeding the paper in at all.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, bad service
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever! I have had the printer for a month and a half. It has not had a lot of use and there are printer and scanner errors that I cannot get rid of. I tried rebooting the printer, didn't fix the issues. Went online for tech support; didn't fix the issues. Called tech support; was told they will send me a refurbished printer as a replacement. Not a new one printer, but a refurbished printer. This will take a week and I had to give them my credit card info as a hold for the broken printer that I need to send back. I will never buy an Epson printer again. Bad product, bad service.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Like it so far!
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased the ET-4760. Set up was easy. Print quality is good. I like the size and the fact that we have eliminated ink cartridges. My only beef so far is that the screen is so tiny. I have to use the eraser end of a pencil to use the screen. I wonder WHY they would make it so tiny! There's plenty of "real estate" to make the screen larger. It's difficult to see and using your finger is a challenge. I hope in the future they fix this design challenge. Other than that, I'm happy with our purchase! I love the fact the Epson is MAC friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Ms Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the promise of cheap ink fool you
customer_reviews.text: I was decieved by the promise of ease of use and low ink cost. For the first 3 months, the printer worked fine. After that, I started getting error messages...it constantly had to have the wifi password re-entered or had to be rebooted. Twic, I have had to delete the printer from the network and re-install the printer drivers. It is now in a fatal error state and I can do nothing. I am waiting to hear back from Epson product support and will change my review if the printer ever works as promised, but I have little hope.
customer_reviews.author: Molly S.

customer_reviews.title: Failure
customer_reviews.text: This printer did not work well or last long. We've had it less than a year and it won't print color. It's full of ink, all the diagnostics indicate it is full, but it will not print color at all and the black ink fades in and out. We don't do a lot of printing, but need a more reliable printer when we do print. This is our second Epson. We loved our first one and were disappointed when after so many hours it claimed to be at the end of its life and wouldn't print and now this one is a disappointment and I haven't been able to get any answers from Epson Support.
customer_reviews.author: John/Sherry Quade

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Total Piece of junk for that price!!!! Software sucks, no usb drive plug in for scan/ print
customer_reviews.author: Hreeves2016

customer_reviews.title: printhead is impossible to clean
customer_reviews.text: if the printhead clogs, like mine did, game over. There is no effective method to clear a clog. The 'clean printhead' function is useless. About 350 color pages, the magenta clogged. After cleaning the printhead, now only the black works. Big ink tanks are useless if the ink doesn't get to the page. IMHO, this is a product to avoid unless you print on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: TJ RolaJeep

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure out that I needed to delete all the other previous printers in my system before the wifi connection would behave itself but once I did that it works like a charm. I haven't tried photos or anything fancy but for everyday wireless printing it seems to be a great little printer. Love the extended life ink thing. No paper jams. Fingers crossed it will serve for many years.
customer_reviews.author: CivilEyes

customer_reviews.title: Your Basic Printer (without the fax)
customer_reviews.text: This Epson is made of lightweight (at times), flimsy plastic. It is a compact, full-size printer. It prints fast. Scans well. (FYI: It DOES NOT have a fax.) Small screen, sometimes difficult to navigate. Black and white images are good, but it doesn't prints color photos well at all. Images are grainy. Disappointing considering the price tag. Our old war horse, the Canon MX882 (R.I.P.), made excellent quality photos. It will be missed.
customer_reviews.author: DigItMan

customer_reviews.title: broke after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: print quality was average. Still had difficulty with software from time to time, maybe 3 print requests to get something printed. Then 7 months from purchase, I get a msg saying paper is out. I remove and replace the paper countless times, taking all panels apart and look for obstructions. Can't see any problems. And the thing is totally useless. A $230 paperweight. The stupid $50 printers I used to buy did better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robert W. Holzbach

customer_reviews.title: Missing lines when printing, buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: I spent $300 on this printer with the promise of not having to buy overpriced print cartridges anymore. It took less than 6 months for the print head to get a few nozzles clogged up and start printing with lines missing. This doesn't normally happen unless you run out of ink ( I haven't) or don't use the printer for extended periods (it gets used regularly) I tried running the print head cleaning functionality repeatedly and it didn't fix the problem. I will be contacting Epson directly and try and get this resolved. For now, my recommendation is DON'T BUY. Maybe they will redesign this and fix the problem. I'm unlikely to spend another $300 to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Dastardly Dad

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Printer quality terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry I normally do not like writing bad reviews. But this printer does not print well. The print quality is faded looking and forget about printing up photos. Terrible. I wanted to return but didn’t hook this up for a month and it was past return time. I am still trying to get the scanner to work. I have had to download so many programs and not one is user friendly. DOES NOT PRINT WELL.
customer_reviews.author: BSB Lover

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer!
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated about purchasing this printer because I didn't know how well it would work. The refill bottles are much cheaper than the print cartridges and the look and flow of the ink seems to be the same as what I have seen from previous color printers. The graphics are vivid and the text is clear to read and not blotchy. I highly recommend this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: QUIT WORKING AFTER A WEEK
customer_reviews.text: DIFFICULT TO SWITCH FROM PAPER TO AN ENVLOPE. NOW CAN'T GET BACK TO PRINT ON PAPER. SAVE YOUR MONEY BUY SOMETHING ELSE. WILL BE RETURNING!
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: No rear paper tray
customer_reviews.text: If someone asks a question in the Q&A and you don't know the answer, do not attempt to answer the question. I asked: "Can anybody tell me if the ET3760 has a rear paper tray?" The answer I received was: "Yes, holds 75 pages comfortably". Once again, if you do not know, then DO NOT ANSWER. Let me settle this once and for all: The ET3760 does NOT have a rear paper tray. Now I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: does not work for a small business setting no matter what box says
customer_reviews.text: not worth the money and I was not refunded my complete amount paid. I was charged a 30 o/o restock fee and amazon said they could not help because of it was a vender .
customer_reviews.author: Chrissi

customer_reviews.title: Great technology - bad for wireless
customer_reviews.text: I am looking forward to using this printer ... so I will need time to use it and re-review it. however ... with the complexities of wireless networking ... total failure. not going into details about it. I had to spend money on a small 5 port switch and cables and BAM ... it worked. For now ... leaving it with a 3 star rating because of the extra expense and time to force it on a wired network. If it performs like I hope it to, I will give it a 4 star but I cold never give it a five star because of the hours I spent in navigating complex wireless security settings
customer_reviews.author: Old Internet User

customer_reviews.title: Once upon a time...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's a common story. Small business person buys an inexpensive printer to help reduce start-up costs. Small business person buys ink cartridge, but gets tired of spending over $50 for a cartridge set. Small business person starts buying remanufactured ink and realizes after a couple of purchases that he/she is probably better off buying the new cartridges. Small business person realizes that he/she is probably spending $250-$300 per year on ink. Small business person decides to get a printer that isn't designed to rip you off. So far I'm very happy with my purchase. I print a lot every day, so this is a great business tool for a small business person.
customer_reviews.author: R. Welch

customer_reviews.title: printer network setup process
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of the Epson tank and print quality is good when it works, but this is hands down the most difficult printer I have ever owned to set up on a wireless network. took four hours with Epson phone support to set up for my PC and it still does not have all the functionality which should exist with a set up. They basically give up after two hours and have you call another tech support rep. Still not able to connect Mac's to the printer. Would not purchase again and may return soon if the Mac mystery cannot be solved by tech support.
customer_reviews.author: jpuzz

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this printer
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is very blotchy for such a high end printer. It can't even come close to comparing to my 100 dollar printer. The colors come out off, even when photo copying. Not high quality at all and definately not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This printer is awful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in September, 2019. It is now January, 2020 and the printer still does not function properly. I have had two on-line chats with tech support and two phone chats with tech support and still, the printer will not print consistently. I am sorry I did not return it immediate;ly. I was relying on Epson's reputation for quality printers and I am sadly disappointed and stuck with an expensive printer that does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M. Wasserman

customer_reviews.title: Wow, so much ink
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a color laser with this to get better print quality on photos. I have printed thousands of pages, and the ink levels have barely decreased. It really does live up to its name. Automatic duplex is also great for reducing the amount of paper you have to use and take with you. Very decent print quality, although every so often (maybe every 100 pages or so) it can get misaligned and you have to reprint the page. Cons: Duplex is a great feature to reduce paper but takes a long time to turn the page over, making duplex printing slow. It's a great machine, but a touchscreen would be nice for a modern printer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Noisy Printer + Document Feeder takes about 5 pages.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sounds like a diesel truck engine when it is printing. I do not mind that as much as the document feeder takes about 5-10 pages. It is tiny. Totally useless except for personal printing. I tried to scan 5 pages of full page receipts, and the one page that was not perfectly flat got snagged over and over again, regardless of how much I tried to flatten it out. I have a Brother printer that takes documents a lot better than this, and it scans at least 50 pages at a time, including the pages that are kind of bent. This printer at the price of $350 is totally over-priced and it is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: spider63

customer_reviews.title: No Sheet Feeder
customer_reviews.text: (Bought the ET-3710) Unless you want to scan every doc one page at a time and copy every doc one page at a time, DO NOT buy this product. The product description doesn't say the product has a sheet feeder, so they're not lying. However, a sheet feeder should be part of every copier/scanner without having to state it. Seriously, how many copiers or scanners have you touched in the past 10 years that didn't have an automatic sheet feeder? I didn't look for it in the product description, but I didn't look for "power cord" in the product description either. I guess Epson has a market for this thing, but I'm not it. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McCurry

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Not the quality that we expected. Color quality comes out faded. Not impressed. Return period already passed so we are stuck with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mariu

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was really nervous about using the ink for first time but it is idiot-proof. I was spending about $400/year on ink-jet cartridges and am SO thrilled to have a quality machine with low, low cost printing and no toner. I had previously used HP printers for the last 3 decades and have watched the quality go down and the price go up - Epson uses higher quality plastic so the printer feels rugged. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Seaver

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: 10/06/2018 After less than one year in personal use, the Epson ET-2750 has stopped printing altogether. The mechanisms work as if it is printing but the print head has stopped working and it delivers blank pages in spite of full ink supply and clean print head. It's still under warranty, so we'll see how Epson handles it. I will report back on the results.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Sirianne

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money on this printer, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: As a developer of communications products for various clients I have used a multiple printers , but this is the worst printer I've purchased, it does not sync with computers very well, the print software is complicated, you can not scan multiple pages at a time which basically makes the scan feature useless, it did not come with a user manual, you have to go online to read it, the touch screen feature is confusing and complicated. I would recommend spending you money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: greg padgett

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement & poor service
customer_reviews.text: Product is falsely advertised, and support is horrible. I bought this in large part for the automatic document feeder. The website clearly states fast 2 sided scanning, printing, etc. The scanner is only one sided, so the only documents that would be fast are 1-sided. Now I need to do this with software afterwards. When I opened a support ticket they sent me a link on how to connect the printer to the network. Printing is okay. Paper tray started jamming after a couple months of occasional use. Great idea, horrible execution.
customer_reviews.author: WaltBoston

customer_reviews.title: EPSON DOES NOT SUPPORT ITS PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: I had a "chat" with an Epson customer support rep of a minor problem with the printer. This person gave me THREE answers to my problem and then disconnected the chat. I talked today to TWO people at US corp HQ and they were no help either. Clearly NOBODY at Epson cares are the residential consumer. If you buy this printer, just TOSS IT if you have any serious problems because Epson is NOT there to help. I expect a certain level of support and they FAILED.
customer_reviews.author: nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Print Labels
customer_reviews.text: The printer is great with ink use and is an ok basic printer, however it doesn't print labels at all (which is not clear on the description), it does not have automatic head cleaning, so you have to periodically clean the head or the quality of the printing is really bad. Not having an auto doc feeder is also a problem when you need to copy multiple pages...you have to place them on the scanner one at a time. It also doesn't fax. In retrospect, it is an incredibly expensive printer when you realize what it doesn't do. I would not have bought this printer had I known of all its shortcomings.
customer_reviews.author: Handy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer - Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very, very happy with this printer. Small in size but works great! There's a review that says it's loud but you can change a setting to turn on Quiet Mode - nice and quiet then. This is the 3710. For those worried about wireless, it comes with the WiFi and WiFi Direct disabled - yay. And it has Ethernet as an alternative. I tried double-sided printing and worked great - this was on card stock. Using ink bottles instead of cartridges not only less $ but so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs more features.
customer_reviews.text: I had an Epson printer in the 2xxx series. You could scan computer, cloud, usb drive, or sim card. I wanted one with a document feed so i got this one. After purchase, I found out you could only scan to WIFI or computer. I actually preferred the scan to USB. Not the listings fault, it didn't say you could. Also, this review asks about the touch screen. It does not have a touch screen. You have to arrow through the options. The description was accurate. I guess I just expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Don Cain

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen doesn't always work
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the copy and scan options work and sometimes they don't. Have not figured out why. Print option works but not the duplex even though that is checked. Touch screen is very temperamental and doesn't always cooperate. Several times I've had to reboot to clear the cache and start over. Wish I had a different machine.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Grannis

customer_reviews.title: WI-FI Settings (NOT)!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive this printer. Loved that the ink would last so long and that you could refill each color separately. This printer prints a wonderful picture. After each print the WI-FI settings have to be reset. It is a definite pain and totally ridiculous. I was hoping to use it for crafting items. Having to reset the wi-fi after each use is annoying and frustrating. This one flaw makes this printer totally useless. We have reinstalled the program and tried every avenue to no avail. DO NOT buy this printer unless you have lots of time and patience and nothing better to do but constantly re-set the settings.
customer_reviews.author: James J Berlin

customer_reviews.title: Poor function. You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a capable printer and a great value. It is poor quality and poor engineering. The user interface is atleast a decade behind. The printer constantly jams. The inks take turn clogging. Overall this is probably a $99 printer. We will likely never purchase an Epson again. We’ll stick with HP printers.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Two flaws
customer_reviews.text: Flaw 1. It does not handle cardstock or Avery forms well. It often reports a jam on the paper feeder. Even if there is no paper jam. I chose this version because it had a simple feed that comes from the back so it doesn't scroll th paper around from a bottom rray. Flaw 2. Even if there is no jam but it reports one, the firmware menu forces you to step through help steps an won't let you print.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm really impressed. I've dealt with a lot of printers that should come with a Xanax prescription. Whether it's dealing with ink, compatibility printers always seem to be a pain. My wife and I needed a reliable printer that could be used primarily to print, but to also scan and copy documents. The setup process took about thirty minutes, but that included filling the ink, aligning the printer, linking Google drive, ect. Now our home office is complete now that we have our Epson 4760 in place.
customer_reviews.author: mbi

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful invention
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving this new printer. I no longer hesitate to send a color document to print out. Watching the ink levels barely move is a good feeling. Not impressed with the print quality but it is ok. I can live with that if it means not buying new ink so often. Overall I happy with this purchase and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Fill it up and let it roll
customer_reviews.text: In the office it connected to 2 PC’s and a Chrome Box and an iPhone right out of the box. High quality performance. Our staff is very happy. Trim appearance. Small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: iamasoul

customer_reviews.title: I tried to hook it up to computer and not an easy task.
customer_reviews.text: There was damage to the printer. It wouldn't print out, you could hear it start to print and then it would hesitate and then quit all together. When I gave it something to print it would tell me that the paper size was wrong. If I have to do that every time when I want to print, I will be sending it back. Epson is replacing the first printer with the same model #. Hopefully the second one will be more understandable!
customer_reviews.author: Diana M.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best printers out there
customer_reviews.text: I now own 2 of these printers, for my 2 home office locations. It has a small footprint. Easy to see ink tank level indicators. Refilling is super easy and it goes for weeks/months between refills. The print quality is excellent for what I use it for. The photo quality is very good, too. The display screen is easy to understand and use. I wish the paper tray held a full ream, not just half a ream.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: A good printer, but prints photos too light
customer_reviews.text: A good printer, but prints photos too light. Its a bit difficult to set up, but once that's done, it prints documents just fine. However, the printed photos are not of great quality, and that's why I bought it in the first place. The seller does not give much time to return, but Amazon exchanged it for me. However, the photos still printed lightly and I could not return it. Also, the tiny screen is annoying and confusing. Its so small you cannot tell which button to push, and it wants you to choose paper on the machine. I would not buy this again, nor would I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Grider

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Frustrated with this printer. Everything is connected through wireless. Printer works and the scanning is off and on. One day, its connected and the next it's not but here's the kicker, I can still print! So obviously, it's not the connection because how else am I connected to print but not connected to scan? With the pandemic, I ordered this printer so I can work from home and as of now, it's not much use. I'm going to return this and I'm quite disappointed seeing that the ink was easy & user friendly to do. I'm pretty technically savvy and was hoping to at least just get the basics from this printer which I am unfortunately, not able to.
customer_reviews.author: ZoeGirlTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Printer clogs (or some failure with equivalent effects) almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice enough printer and the eco-tank seems like a good idea, but you pay up front for that feature and then have little recourse when the performance is crappy. In my case the color print failed after a few uses (I'm guessing clogging, because I didn't use color for about a month, but seriously?). Features the Epson print connect (so you can print an attachment automatically by emailing yourself) but since it just doesn't print any more I can't give it a passing grade. I think the technology is not ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Photo Printing is Really Bad
customer_reviews.text: Its photo-printing-capabilities are really poor - the color is severely off, and the overall quality is not good. The ink does last quite a while, but the tiny screen and constant messages about "firmware needing to be updated" is really annoying. I've downloaded everything I can and "updated" several times, but it's only about 5 minutes after an "update" that it tells me "new firmware has been released".
customer_reviews.author: LizzieH29

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to Economy Printing!
customer_reviews.text: Sooo awesome. This prints really well. Replacing an HP printer and all that expensive ink. Took me a long time to take this out of the box because I thought the setup was going to be difficult but it wasn't. It was actually fun setting up the ink and I love the way this looks inside my office - sleek and black. Photos print out nicely and double-sided printing is a breeze - the printer does it for you. I don't need to take the paper out and flip it over like back in the day. Ha! Welcome to the new age of printing.
customer_reviews.author: TBS

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer primarily because of its "supertank" feature. After printing about 40 copies (in total, not at one time) the paper stopped feeding into the printer. The paper loads from the back and it sounds like the printer wants to pull the paper in, but it doesnt. I did find a small piece of plastic that looks to be a portion of a gear inside the unit. About the size of a dime. I contacted Amazon and they replaced the printer within two days. I can use the new box to ship the broken box back with a prepaid label. So I changed my rating to 5 stars and attribute the bad piece to just some bad luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more cartridges
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace another Epson printer with 5 cartridges. Even buying the extra large capacity cartridges we were constantly change cartridges. With the Eco tank system I hope to avoid that while reducing our overall ink consumption costs. They claim in the first tank fill I should net about 6000 pages before having to add ink to one of the tanks. So far so good. You pay more for this printer but if it lasts, the cartridge costs will easily be recouped in time. Only negative is this printer has no SD or USB card slots.
customer_reviews.author: DougN

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating Interface, Terrible Help Documentation
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I could have given this printer a better review, but after just one year the printer has stopped printing despite the ink levels being full, and the printer itself provides very little to no instruction on whether the print nozzle has been blocked or something else. An interface that doesn't provide warning for common issues is pretty much useless. I'll have to continue to play around and see what I can do with it, but it's pretty disappointing that this is more or less unusable after only minimal use (really only used for copying and printing).
customer_reviews.author: coffeescripting

customer_reviews.title: It quit working properly after about 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Hasn't even been a year and it won't print all colors at the same time so it either only prints blue and green or it prints only pink. I've done everything I can think of to correct the problem but nothing works. So frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: queentulie

customer_reviews.title: Never worked right from day 1 feed and print quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Horrible photo quality. Too much ink put down on photos orange peel looking never dries continues to smear for ever. Wont feed sheets of 4x6 photo paper ever. Says out of paper when plenty in tray. worst printer ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: My previous printer was the Epson ET-2750 which I purchased for the eco-tank feature. It was an excellent printer for the price considering the significant cost savings from not having to purchase ink cartridges. The photo print quality is good but not great but that's a reflection of the price. After 2 1/2 years of use the ET-2750 no longer functioned properly, seemed to be more of a software problem than hardware. I replaced it with the ET-2760 which is essentially the same printer, same quality. Thumbs up so far!
customer_reviews.author: Davidsam

customer_reviews.title: Super printer BUT document feeder for scanner is quite persnickety.
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is excellent and Epson thought "outside the box" when they came up with the large capacity ink tanks. I would have rated this printer higher except I scan in lots of documents and the ADF is REALLY frustrating. Even with sheets of paper that are not wrinkled or crinkled, half the time, the paper jams. Want to scan paper that is narrower than 8.5"? Good luck! The slider to abut the side of the paper is woefully inadequate, so you will have to use the flat scanner bed; if you have lots of this type scanning to do, choose another printer. My 5 year old "cheapo" Brother is better at scanning.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gary Griffin

customer_reviews.title: THE WORST PRINTER I EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: This printer would not communicate with my other devices unless I unplugged it and then told it to print. It wasted so much of my time. I have had several Epson printers and was happy but the quality has definitely gone down. This printer couldn't even copy my drivers license well enough to legible for what I needed. Never had that issue with Epson in the past. WON'T BUY EPSON AGAIN. So sad I got rid of my old printer because it was to big. Smaller isn't better at all. I learned my lesson. Bye Bye Epson.
customer_reviews.author: CBlockey

customer_reviews.title: Long on ink . . . Short on features!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a second printer for my home office. Although easy to set up, it is not as user-friendly as my old WF-3620. However, the print quality is good. Also, the WF-2750 is a bit pricey for the few features it has. I guess you must sacrifice a color touchscreen control panel, front load paper tray, top document loader, and a fax machine for a printer that holds more ink for more than $100 difference in price? If I had to do it again, I would buy another WF-3620 and use an external CISS like I did with my other printer. The same price with loads of better features!!
customer_reviews.author: William Hearn

customer_reviews.title: WiFi problematic but otherwise good printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer continually disconnected from WiFi which was a problem, when power cycled it would work great then after a while all computers would show it as offline and the web interface would not even connect, eventually it would come back but would timeout several times first. On WiFi only I would not recommend this printer right now, however I was able to wire it into my network using the Ethernet port and since then I have but had any issues. I hope Epson correct the WiFi issue as it was very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Leaves gaps in lines and images
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I have ever had. Support says to do a deep clean to get the gaps out. I have done that several times and it only lasts for a very short time. Maybe a month. When you do a deep clean it takes 1/4 of the ink from the tank. You have to have at least 1/2 of a tank before you do a deep clean. So this ink economical printer becomes very expensive to maintain to use. I will never buy another Epson. I will go back to the HP printers.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Brown

customer_reviews.title: Subpar quality
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this unit!!. This unit is very badly made. I bought the printer 6 months ago. The document feeding unit didn't work and I returned it to Amazon and got a replacement. The document feeder stopped working after 5 months, in the second unit. Since it's under warranty Epson is willing a replace it, but only with a refurbished unite and the warranty for this unit will end by the end of the original warranty. So an all in one unit that cost $ 356 is covered for only one year and by the end of the year, I'm invited to trash it if I have a problem. I certainly​ not going to buy any Epson product again.
customer_reviews.author: Talia Sasson

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: Although still a very new device, it was very easy to install and setup! Print quality is excellent and it is fast! Love the fact that it is wireless and it supports AirPrint which is amazing! I also love that I don't have to install expensive cartridges! So far, so good! No cons at the moment!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Tanzillo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap ink? Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. 3 months in and we are very happy with it. Prints wirelessly without any problems. Even tried a few photos that came out well. Ink should last a long time but when it finally runs out I have several bottles of ink left-over from when I used to refill lots of various cartridges thru the years. So happy we can finally print without the angst of buying way over-priced replacement cartridges, or in my case, getting ink all over my hands and the sink when refilling and then fighting to get the ink flowing again. Hopefully things will proceed smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: F. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Printer,Small Screen
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this printer is fantastic that is the set up with the ink ,connecting to my home network all was fast and simple to understand...The only problem I have with this printer is the display screen, can it be any smaller???Someone at epson deserves a swift kick in the butt for this one. I really do care that its not a touch screen just make the thing bigger so us older folks don't have to put our face close to the printer to read the screen....
customer_reviews.author: G. Dudonis

customer_reviews.title: Color printing can be good, then I will get lines and drips
customer_reviews.text: Color printing can be good, then I will get lines and drips. I'll choose to print in B & W, and it will print in color anyway. It's 2018, can someone make a decent printer please?
customer_reviews.author: 2halvesofacoconut

customer_reviews.title: A one-sided review.
customer_reviews.text: It's OK for a small home office, but the automatic document feeder only holds about 30 pages, and more troubling, the ADF does not scan two-sided pages. You can PRINT two-sided pages, but not scan them. This is not made clear in the description, and, in my opinion, is like buying a car that can go fast, but not brake. If that doesn't concern you, you'll like this printer. Otherwise, save your money and make sure that your duplexing printer also scans both sides.
customer_reviews.author: D_ElH

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! Prints crisp beautiful copy.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and prints beautiful in color and sharp crisp black and white. The only negative is that you can only scan one page at a time. I had to call Epson for some help setting up scanner and they walked me through it step by step (my computer was the problem). Very good customer service from Epson. The best part is I do not have to worry about expensive INK.
customer_reviews.author: BARB

customer_reviews.title: Best personal printer I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Best personal printer I have owned. I’ve been using this guy for about five months now, and I have barely made a dent in the ink usage. I was burning through $60 a month in ink on my older Epson printer. I love the two-sided printing and the print quality is high. The auto paper-feed seemed to want to pull more than one sheet at a time in fax mode, but that’s the only thing I have noticed that isn’t perfect. I bet if I used better quality paper, it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineBuyer-US

customer_reviews.title: Great ink life but garbage printer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in June 2018. 5 months later the magenta would not print. I use it daily for maybe 20 pages a day so still had 7/8 ink remaining. Epson replaced the printer which was great but 6 months later the same thing happened but I was just outside of the 1 year warranty. They said I needed to take it to a Epson repair center and I would have to pay for the repair. So... basically you have ink that lasts forever but now the printer is disposable. Net net, it's cheaper to buy ink for a better printer. Stay far away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: Great printer-scanner combo
customer_reviews.text: Great combo printer/scanner. Works with USB connecting cable or via WiFi printing. Love the ink compartments -- it shows ink levels. We have moderate amount of printing and the levels have hardly gone down--no more ink cartridges! Colors are very good. We really like this printer so far, and I did a lot of research. The only downside is that it does not have a document feeder on top, and we had to figure out how to scan multiple pages into one PDF document... (not easy)
customer_reviews.author: Booklover5

customer_reviews.title: $$$$$$$$$$ saved on ink
customer_reviews.text: We are real estate agents so print ALOT!! Got tired of spending BIG $ for printer cartridges for our "xxxxx" printer so decided on the ET-2750 - this printer is working perfectly and after printing a ton of pages the ink tanks levels have not moved !!! This printer will save us many hundreds of $ this year.
customer_reviews.author: igolf2

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay connected to the network..
customer_reviews.text: I have had to reset the password and reconnect every time the printer sits idle for more than 24 to 36 hrs.. my last episode, today, it just circles the drain.. I purchased this in February of this year and support expired 3 days ago.. this is my second of these and the first, had similar problem, disconnecting but only every few months.. do not buy this unless you are very tech savy... you will regret it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Baird

customer_reviews.title: Loooonnnggg WiFi setup process
customer_reviews.text: Touch screen isn't really a touch screen. The printer has up, down, left, right, ok, and back button to enter the wifi password. It's not immediately apparent how to swap between upper case and lower case. Once you get past that, you end up endlessly pressing up or down to select one of 26 letters at a time - with the back button so close to the down button, it continually registered back instead of down which cleared the password and put me back at the SSID selection. If your passphrase is long and secure, plan on spending quite a bit of time just getting the printer online.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Stricker, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Love the ink wells
customer_reviews.text: I got white Epson ET-3760. The set up was easy except be careful when downloading the driver. Something "jumped in" and instead of clicking on the Epson driver I clicked on something else that wiped out audio and internet. Had to take computer in for an over-haul.. As for the printer, I love being able to visually see the ink level in windows on the printer itself. I don't like that it doesn't have a touch screen==use up/down arrows. But, so far I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SophieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not All Pages Print In Same Color Tone!
customer_reviews.text: I use my printer to make journals so I use my printer a lot. I was excited to get this printer hoping I would be able to print out digital kits. However it prints great the first 15 pages but after that the color is more orange and yellow looking. I use presentation paper and regular copy paper for various things. But no matter what I print the first 15 or so pages are great then the rest come out looking orange. I’ll clean the heads and still the same results. A lot of money for this printer and I’m so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Donna S. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: NEVER BUY AN EPSON PRINTER.
customer_reviews.text: EPSON PRINTERS ARE JUNK. I'VE BEEN USING PRINTERS OF VARIOUS MANUFACTURES FOR OVER THIRTY YEARS AND NEVER PURCHASED A PRODUCT AS BADLY DESIGNED AS THIS ET-2750 PRINTER. IT NEVER WAS ABLE TO PRINT TWO SIDED OUT OF THE BOX. IT WOULD JAMB EVERY TIME. 4 MONTHS AFTER PURCHASING AND TRYING TO TROUBLE SHOOT THE PROBLEM WITH EPSON TECH SUPPORT WITH NO SUCCESS I HAD TO GO AND BUY A NEW PRINTER BY A DIFFERENT MANUFACTURER. WAITING TO GET CREDIT OR REFUND. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THESE INFERIOR MACHINES.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy C. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Say goodby to those Cartridges!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for one reason....and one reason only. I previously owned a 4-in-1 printer from another manufacturer for many years. Every-time I turned around, the printer would stop working because one of the cartridges would "think" it was empty. Very seldom did I print in color, but each of the three color cartridges would take turns to STOP ME FROM PRINTING. You couldn't buy the cartridges ahead of time because they have a "time" chip inside that would not let you print if you didn't use it fast enough. I had just had enough of this inconvenience, so I bought this EPSON. Easy to get hooked up....and easy to use. For my peace of mind....IT'S PERFECT !!!
customer_reviews.author: golf2000

customer_reviews.title: The 4th best thing to ever happen to me
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my ecotank!!!! I set it up with ease (and help from my husband) and started printing right away. I think I printed at least 100 pages on my first night and the ink is still full. Happy dance!!!!! I'm a printing fool!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer and was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the amt of ink that comes in the bottles and the set up instructions were easy to follow. What was a nightmare, was trying to figure out how to scan wirelessly. It required me downloading Epson's scanning software and another EsponNet Config file, to get my scanner's IP address. The choosing the scan option on the printer, it still won't identify my computer, but the scan software I downloaded bypasses that. This wasted too much of my time, and should never be this diffucult. Otherwise, I again, love the print quality, esp on the Premium Matte Presentation Paper for printing scrapbook/journaling printables.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Eiss

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The printer started out nice, but within 2 months the paper feed stopped working and it made a loud noise. It took me 3 days to get through to Epson, was told they will send a refurbished one. I bought a NEW one just a few weeks ago, now I'm being sent a USED one. This was after I was transferred a few times and had to keep giving my information over and over. Epson has the worst customer service, the worst replacement policy, the worst phone system. They are just the WORST! I will never buy an Epson again. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Marilee M

customer_reviews.title: Not the best printer for photos.
customer_reviews.text: Printing photos is important to me. Compared to the Canon Pygma that I had used before, the Epson ET 3710 photos I've printed are barely adequate. I'm counting on the lower cost of the ink tanks to make me happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was Best printer ever!  Now it is junk.
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with this printer at first. I have had it since Jan, 2019 and it is now Oct, 2019. For the last 3 months it has not printed colors except blue. My ink levels have barely moved from the top so I don't think it is due to ink supply. I have been told it is probably due to a print head problem, which means, I guess, that I need a new printer. I am not so happy with this printer anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed at how little ink has been used
customer_reviews.text: While I do miss not having the automatic feeder for copies and scans (wasn't interested in paying the extra $ for that feature), I am THRILLED to not have to constantly replace the ink cartridges. We previously had an HP printer, and that thing devoured print cartridges. And we didn't even print that much!!! I did have a big project I was working on right after purchasing this printer and have printed many, many pages. I am amazed at how little ink has been used. Easy setup. Filling the ink was a breeze. Very, very pleased with this purchase! Took off 1 star only because the price is a bit higher.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Well this printer was easy to assemble and use. But I found out that you can get the best quality prints by using the Epson app. Try it people you won’t regret it. Pictures are of the best quality. It’s a great printer. Not sure how the ink life will be but so far I am beyond happy with my purchase. Works fast, very easy to use and is good quality printing. I definitely recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Olga Cowo

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a few weeks, but now the rear paper will not feed and it keeps saying it's jammed when it isn't. It fails to recognize that the problem is solved and keeps canceling my print jobs. Also, it's requiring me to set the paper type on BOTH the computer and the printer. Major fail! Wasted money and worthless printer. Alas, failed just after it was too late to return it. Also very noisy and the interface is tiny and NOT user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Bigmommabird

customer_reviews.title: Love This Printer
customer_reviews.text: When our somewhat costly Canon printer died on us, we were in the market for a more affordable, yet good quality printer with individual color cartridge features. We did our research and chose this Epson printer. We are not disappointed. What a quality printer and scanner! The refillable cartridges are a huge money saver (and earth friendly)! Printing out an image in color on white cardstock paper, standard setting, was surprisingly clear with framing quality...beautiful. Setup was easy. On matte picture paper, color images are stunning. This is a great little printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: We wasted so much time on this printer to set it up but and keeps giving us “error” at this point all we want just to return it . Upon contacting the seller they notified us that the window of opportunity for returning this item is closed . Our office was shutdown for pandemic and since we got back to the office almost two weeks ago we just trying to set this up and start working . Horrible customer service and now during this difficult time I’m stock with a defective product and a big hole in my pocket where as a small business owner trying to bring back my employees to work .
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is COOL. It took me about 2-1/2 hours to set it up. I’ve never had a tank printer. And I have arthritis so I move slow. I actually read the instructions before I started to set it up. So very very glad I did. I have printed straight from my girlfriends house to the printer. The scan functionality is incredibly fast and quiet. I’ve never had a scanner so fast. The phone app is so versatile and handy.
customer_reviews.author: AlanofDale

customer_reviews.title: Love the ink capacity, jams easily on thicker paper
customer_reviews.text: Not having to replace ink often is AWESOME. Double sided is GREAT! One thing that we don't like is it seems to jam on non-regular paper easily. Labels, photos, etc. Even playing with the paper setting hasn't helped. We've looked online and one suggested to make sure the paper setting on the printer and from Windows is set to a thicker matte paper. Still jammed on printing labels. One tip we read is to make sure you print something regularly (at least a few times a week) otherwise something about the ink getting heavy and weighing something down makes it easier to jam. Still jammed on printing labels.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri K

customer_reviews.title: No duplex printing capability
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed to learn that this printer does not facilitate duplex scanning or printing. They claim one can print duplex by reloading each page one at a time which of course is possible but ridiculous. One would think a printer in this price range would include such a feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazaholic

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised at the good print quality
customer_reviews.text: Because this uses the cheap huge ink containers that you directly fill instead of expensive cartridges I thought the print quality wouldn't be very good. But, the quality is excellent. It prints quickly. It works great from cell phone or you can just email it something and it will print it, cool feature. Now I don't have to yell at the kids for printing stupid stuff and they can print whatever they want. Very happy with it and have used it a lot. Some pictures, which came out great, but mostly just standard homework, insurance papers, forms, and stuff. Haven't used the scanner or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel NB

customer_reviews.title: Don't install firmware
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this to avoid ink cartridges as a simple printer with wifi. It worked for 5 months but was spotty as far as wifi connection direct, but worked via email ok. It was slow, but accurate. When I updated the firmware the printer stopped working. I had to connect it to my computer and reset it directly. After that it said the printers waste ink pad was full and needed serviced. I don't think I printed more than 150 pages. I used a trial reset utility only to find that my printer says a mysterious page is stuck inside. I'm done. That was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sorriest piece of crap EVER!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer based on the many great reviews and of course the INK!!!! BUT I had it for barely 6 months, I printed something at least weekly as required....maybe I had printed 150 papers and it sounded like a roadgrader on a gravel road--like every gear inside had broken--I did everything the support said to do but nothing helped. So I contacted customer service several times with NO RESULTS....I am still waiting on them to replace it but I really doubt they will. I would not buy another piece of their shoddy work even if they paid me to take it...To say I was so disappointed in this product is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Quick Response Time
customer_reviews.text: We got the tank refill copier all in one. The cartridges have gone up so much in cost that you will save in the long run if you purchase the tank refill copier. The inks for the tank refill are very reasonable. This copier has a quick quiet response time. This is our first Epson purchase, and we couldn't be happier with the way it performs!
customer_reviews.author: Lindak

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer and the ink set up!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this printer nearly every day for roughly a month and it has preformed excellently! I have no complaints. I love the ink design. It’s simple and seems to already be saving us money on the ink side of things. The printer is more expensive than printers with traditional ink cartridges however in about six months this one will be cheaper over all with the amount of printing I do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst quality of prints
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be good buy for its ink efficiency but the quality of the prints is not acceptable. It can print Word documents okay but when it comes to documents from websites they are all too light and unreadable. I contacted their tech support but he was helpless, just saying it was just due to the webpage. So I tried to print more documents from variety of websites, including a couple invoices of Amazon.com they are all the same results. My other printers worked fine with these websites. I don't think it is the problem of the websites but the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Epo

customer_reviews.title: Great copier for saving on ink
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don't have to buy ink cartridges anymore, saving hundreds in cost. Paying more for this type of printer is worth it. Buying a cartridge printer is cheap initially, but you end up paying more for the constant need to replace ink cartridges, that you could have brought this printer many times over. The setup was easily followed, and not too long. The print are crisp and vivid, and the printer fits nicely on my desktop without using too much room. The only criticism I have is the LCD screen is small, about 1"X1" I would have preferred a screen at least 2X2, other than that, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money to Save on Ink
customer_reviews.text: From the very beginning, I had issues with the scan feature on this printer. The directions are not easily discernable on this printer. When I got the last error message on the printer I could not clear it. I bought the printer in May and returned it to Amazon in September. It was still under the factory 2-year warranty, but it was outside of the normal return window. Amazon charged an $80.00 restocking fee. I was glad to get rid of it. I bought another printer for under $100.00; it is the second one I have owned under this manufacturer. It works great and I do not mind paying the $60.00 for the 4 ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Sanders

product_meta.title: Epson EcoTank ET-2750 Wireless Color All-in-One Cartridge-Free Supertank Printer with Scanner, Copier and Ethernet, Regular
product_meta.description:
Style:ET-2750 (3-in-1 for Home, black)

The Expression ET-2750 EcoTank wireless all-in-one offers revolutionary cartridge-free printing with easy-to-fill, supersized ink tanks. It includes up to 2 years of ink in the box (1). That’s an incredible amount of ink — enough to print up to 5,200 pages (2), and equivalent to about 30 ink cartridge sets (3). Plus, it features auto-stop ink bottles with each color uniquely keyed for easy filling of each tank. And, you save up to 80 percent on ink with low-cost replacement bottles (4). The ET-2750 also offers convenient wireless printing from tablets and smartphones (5), plus Wi-Fi Direct (6) and auto 2-sided printing.

1. Based on average monthly print volumes of about 150 pages. 
2. Included ink bottle yields based on the ISO/IEC 24712 pattern with Epson’s methodology. Actual ink yields will vary considerably for reasons including images printed, print settings, temperature and humidity. Yields may be lower when printing infrequently or predominantly with one ink color. All ink colors are used for printing and printer maintenance, and all colors must be available for printing. For more information, visit our official site. 
3. Equivalent cartridge sets estimate based on print yields of the included Black and color ink bottles as compared to Epson standard-capacity ink cartridge sets for similarly featured cartridge printers as of March 2017. 
4. Savings comparison based on the purchase cost of replacement ink bottles and the cost of enough cartridges to achieve the total page yields of the bottles using the manufacturers’ online prices and yields for the highest-capacity cartridges for the best-selling, similarly featured consumer inkjet printers priced at $499 or less per NPD, July 2016. Actual savings will vary based on print tasks, print volumes and usage conditions.
5. Most features require an Internet connection to the printer, as well as an Internet- and/or email-enabled device. For a list of Epson Connect enabled printers and compatible devices and apps, visit our official site.
6. Wi-Fi Certified; level of performance subject to the range of the router being used. Wi-Fi Direct may require printer software.
7. Adapter may be required.
8. 12 months of standard limited warranty or 50,000 plain paper sheets (whichever happens first). For an additional 12 months (total of 24 months or 50,000 plain paper sheets, whichever happens first), register your product and use Epson genuine ink bottles. See Limited Warranty for details.
9. ET-2500/2550/2600/2650/2700/2750/3600/3700/3750/4500/4550/4750/16500 included ink bottle yields based on the ISO/IEC 24712 pattern with Epson’s methodology. ET-7700/7750 included ink bottle photo yields are significantly lower and are based on the ISO/IEC 29103 pattern with Epson’s methodology. WF-R4640 included ink pack yields are estimated based on ISO/IEC 24711 test in Default Mode printing continuously. Actual ink yields will vary considerably for reasons including images printed, print settings, temperature and humidity. Yields may be lower when printing infrequently or predominantly with one ink color. All ink colors are used for printing and printer maintenance, and all colors must be available for printing. For more information, visit our official site. 
10. Based on average monthly document print volumes of about 150 pages (ET-2500, ET-2550, ET-2600, ET-2650, ET-2700, ET-2750, ET-4500), 300 pages (ET-3600, ET-3700, ET-3750, ET-4550, ET-4750, ET-7700, ET-7750, ET-16500), and 800 pages (WF-R4640). 
11. For convenient and reasonable recycling options, visit our official site. 
12. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.
feature_bullets: Epson strongly recommends the use of Genuine Epson inks for a quality printing experience. Non Epson inks and inks not formulated for your specific printer may cause damage that is not covered by the Epson warranty.
Cartridge-free printing — Comes with upto 2 years of ink in the box (1)
Includes enough ink to print upto 6,500 pages black/5,200 color (2) — Equivalent to about 30 ink cartridge sets (3)

Save upto 80 percent on ink with low-cost replacement bottles (4) — plus easy-to-fill, supersized ink tanks. Operating Systems - Windows 10, 8, 8.1 (32-bit, 64-bit), 7 (32-bit, 64-bit), Mac OS X 10.6 – macOS 10.12.x10
Easy wireless — Easily print from iPad, iPhone, Android tablets and smartphones (5); Includes Wi-Fi Direct (6)
Auto 2-sided printing — Save upto 50 percent of your paper supply. Maximum Print Resolution: 5760 x 1440 optimized dpi

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,182 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
